description: Further Strengthening of Dots strategy in Bosnia and Herzegovina

subproject.description:
The primary goal of this project is to ensure effective and efficient implementation of the “Further Strengthening of DOTS Strategy in BiH” grant of the Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria (GFATM) to BiH and implemented by UNDP BiH, in function a Principal Recipient nominated by Country Coordinating Mechanism (CCM). 

1.Increased Capacity for Case Detection
Engage 25 Regional Coordinators, 2 TB Specialist  and 75 patronage nurses
Training material prepared according to International Standards of Care 
Trainings delivered as per defined work-plan 

2.Ensured access to TB programme for vulnerable population; 
Engage of mobile teams for better peripheral coverage in remote areas
Trainings conducted as per the work plans
Engage of volunteers to reach IDPs, minorities to improve the capability of identifying suspects to provide education and awareness on the disease

3.Maintained control of Drug resistance through detection and effective treatment of new cases  
Procurement of equipment for laboratories
Renovation of the premises of the TB labs and development of DOTS+ strategy
Developing of GLC application 

4.Adopted the new Stop TB strategy and strengthened  DOTS all over the Country
Creation and maintenance  of web page
Procurement of first-line TB drugs (FLD) for whole the country and procurement of second line anti-TB drugs (SLD)
Travel site inspection and distribution of collateral material as well as  printing of leaflets, booklets and posters

5. Monitoring and Evaluation
Monitoring and evaluation will be performed using results-based quantitative and qualitatively indicators as outlined in the programme’s expected results framework and the revenue and capital budgets. 

6. Project Management
